item.title: Trump Is About to Lose Control of the Economy
item.description: Will anyone be in charge?

item.title: America Needs to Weatherproof Its Homes. Badly.
item.description: Our future resilience depends on more than how much we spend on disaster response. It depends on when we spend it.

item.title: By Killing Renee Good, ICE Sent a Message to Us All
item.description: Not even citizens are safe in Trump’s America.

item.title: The Cruelty of Trump’s Crackdown on Afghan Refugees
item.description: Mr. Trump’s dishonorable treatment of Afghan refugees is morally wrong and makes Americans everywhere less safe.

item.title: Trump Is Threatening Greenland and Europe
item.description: Any attempt to seize Greenland from Denmark would fatally undermine the world’s most successful military alliance.

item.title: The Trump Interview: A President Who Answers Only to Himself
item.description: Readers react to President Trump’s interview with The New York Times. Also: Mayor Zohran Mamdani, Jews and Israel.

item.title: There Is a Sickness Eating Away at American Democracy
item.description: Jan. 6 is a symptom. Elite impunity is the cause.

item.title: What Happens When No One Can Say No to Trump?
item.description: After the capture of the Venezuelan president, Nicolás Maduro, over the weekend, “Trump is setting a new course for the country where he can use the military to do just about anything he wants,” argues Times Opinion’s editor, Kathleen Kingsbury. “No one is allowed to say ‘no’ to Trump.”

item.title: Child Sexual Abuse Destroyed My Family. Here’s What Could Have Helped.
item.description: We spend billions of dollars on punishing child sexual abusers and far less on prevention. It’s not stopping the problem. We must rethink our approach.

item.title: This Is Trump’s One Small Trick to Destroy American Democracy
item.description: The president is claiming borderless license to turn on his perceived enemies, both foreign and domestic.

item.title: The Sins of the Moderates
item.description: How are we classical liberals of left, right and center supposed to behave in this new world?

item.title: Venezuela Is the Tip of the Iceberg
item.description: In the Trump era, there are a lot of contenders for the 51st state.

item.title: Venezuela, Trump Came to Liberate Your Oil, Not Your People
item.description: Trump will soon discover that the only way to revive major American oil investments in Venezuela is to revive Venezuela’s democracy.

item.title: I’m the Mayor of Minneapolis. Trump Is Lying to You.
item.description: This administration is making cities less safe.

item.title: ICE Killing in Minnesota: A ‘Blatant and Tragic Use of Deadly Force’
item.description: Readers react to news reports and video of the fatal shooting of a 37-year-old woman by an ICE agent.

item.title: The Normalization of ‘FAFO’ Might Be Good for English
item.description: The F-word is no longer the deadliest word in the English language.

item.title: Kennedy Is Telling Americans How to Eat. It’s Not Crazy Advice.
item.description: Newly released dietary guidelines emphasize protein and full-fat dairy.

item.title: My Grandfather Sexually Abused Countless Children. Could He Have Been Stopped?
item.description: We spend billions of dollars on punishing child sexual abusers and far less on prevention. It’s not stopping the problem. We must rethink our approach.

item.title: The Great Unraveling Has Begun
item.description: As states disregard limits on the lawful use of force, this may be just the beginning of a slide into frequent war.

item.title: The Landlords Are Not the Problem
item.description: Trump’s plan to block institutional investment won’t work. The way to make houses more affordable is to build more.

item.title: From Kardashian Injectable Lips to Mar-a-Lago Face
item.description: Tressie McMillan Cottom, Jessica Grose and Meher Ahmad on why plastic surgery and fillers no longer feel like a secret — or a stigma.

item.title: Child Sexual Abuse Destroyed My Family. Here’s What Could Have Helped.
item.description: We spend billions of dollars on punishing child sexual abusers and far less on prevention. It’s not stopping the problem. We must rethink our approach.

item.title: Trump Has a New Motto
item.description: What happens when America First becomes the Americas first?

item.title: The Mysterious ‘Donroe Doctrine’
item.description: Trump’s former Venezuela envoy Elliott Abrams argues that America’s sudden presence there is not about spreading democracy.

item.title: Venezuela Is Not Iraq
item.description: “This is not the Middle East”: The former Venezuela envoy Elliott Abrams tells the Opinion columnist Ross Douthat to “stop making Iraq analogies.”

item.title: How Machado Lost Her Chance to Lead Venezuela
item.description: The opposition leader’s uncompromising style explains her political rise. But will that brand of politics work as well when it comes to running a country?

item.title: A Future for Confession
item.description: The sacrament of penance’s 21st-century allure.

item.title: What I Saw When I Peeked Over the Edge of Consciousness
item.description: Facing death is a core part of making meaning of one’s life. To struggle through this universal contemplation without a community can be brutal.

item.title: U.S. Threats to Take Over Greenland
item.description: Readers discuss comments by Stephen Miller about U.S. power and by the Danish prime minister about NATO. Also: Deaths on subway tracks.

item.title: Trump’s Voters Are Discovering What ‘America First’ Really Means
item.description: Whether or not the Venezuelan raid was advisable, it was Trumpian.

item.title: After Removing Maduro, Trump Needs a New Venezuela Plan
item.description: A Republican House member argues that the Maduro raid was good — but the operation’s success still hangs in the balance.

item.title: Trump Is Falling for a Trap We Could All See Coming
item.description: Trump’s increasing belligerence abroad should raise alarm about more than the fate of Venezuela.

item.title: I May Be Free, but the Belarusian People Are Not
item.description: The world must not stop supporting dissidents in Belarus, despite the release of some from prison.

item.title: The Trump Revolution Is Going Much Further Than We Realize
item.description: The president is deploying his domineering tactics in unexpected places.

item.title: A Defense of U.S. Intervention in Venezuela
item.description: The former envoy Elliott Abrams says the administration should push harder for regime change.

item.title: Minnesota’s Fraud Should Be a Wake-Up Call for Democrats
item.description: The specter of welfare fraud haunted Democrats under Reagan. It could do so again.

item.title: America Is Bad at Accountability
item.description: “The United States has a problem with elite impunity,” says the Opinion columnist Jamelle Bouie, as he looks back on the five years since the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol.

item.title: There Were Good Reasons to Depose Maduro
item.description: But taking Venezuela’s oil while leaving the regime in place weren’t among them.

item.title: Recalling the Horrors of Jan. 6
item.description: Readers respond to an essay by Representative Jamie Raskin and to an editorial. Also: Risky changes in vaccine policy; a new Kennedy Center.

item.title: The Judge in the Maduro Case Must Step Aside
item.description: There is no simple procedural mechanism for lawyers, or the public, to challenge the fitness of judges.

item.title: What Trump Wants in Venezuela
item.description: The journalist Jonathan Blitzer explains the various interests and factions at play in the Trump administration’s strike against Venezuela.

item.title: Jamie Raskin: Jan. 6 Never Ended
item.description: Five years after Jan. 6, 2021, we are still caught up in a struggle over the meaning of that day.

item.title: Donald Trump Was Right to Oust Maduro
item.description: President Trump made a bold decision, and it was a stunning success.

item.title: Is This MAGA Foreign Policy or Something Else Entirely?
item.description: David French and M. Gessen on why the ends do not justify the means in Venezuela.

item.title: Don’t Call It Regime Change. This Is Something Else Entirely.
item.description: To understand what’s unfolding in Venezuela, you have to look to the mob, not traditional foreign policy doctrines.

item.title: The Aftermath of Trump’s Raid on Venezuela
item.description: Readers worry about the repercussions and a resurfacing of “America’s imperialist past.”
